instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.Q7706: What is Q7706? Q7706 takes PPBUS_G3H's main 12.6v and sends it through to the backlight circuit. If Q9706 is not allowing PPBUS_G3H through, you will get no voltage on the backlight circuit. Q7706 is a P channel MOSFET, meaning power will flow through it when the voltage on the gate is lower than on the source. Look at pin 3. R7788 takes the 12.6v that is on the source and places it right on pin 3. This will set Q7706 to "off", and not allow it to pass power, as the voltage on the source and the gate are identical..

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
Hi,

This one had liquid exposure towards the centre of the board. At least that's all I can see here

Issues:

Slow performance
Fan High Speed constantly
No sound via speakers nor headphones
Backlight goes on and off

I put it thru Crest cleaner as it was quite dirty

After crest sounds seems to be back (some audible regular 'burp' from the speakers) but other issues remain
Cant see anything wrong under the scope 

Some readings below:

<TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR>

1 8.59v 7.92v switching from one to another
2 8.6v 7.92 same as pin 1
3 8.35v 6.4v jumping
4 8.6v
5 from 0v to 6.2v (variation of values)
6 looks like I am "draining it" will go from 2.3v to 0v every time I put the probes on

<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>

1 8v goes down, then raises up
2 16v and "draining down"

F7700

1 8.6v
2 8.6v

There is a continuity between <DIODE>D7701</DIODE> and A5 ball of <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>


Please assist

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
"Fan High Speed constantly"
Usually trackpad board/flex.
Sometime caused by LIO board/flex.
Their connectors can get problems by corrosion too.

As per schematic, p?ns 1, 2, 5, 6 for <TRANSISTOR>Q7706</TRANSISTOR> are tied together.
Check if pins 2 & 5 of <TRANSISTOR>Q7707</TRANSISTOR> are steady high.

Do you get steady 3V3 at pins 18/19 of J8300?
Also check pin 14 level.
Image always present, only backlight flickers?

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message: These issues all sound like they are related to the IO board and cable. Have you tried new ones?

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
[B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/1153-johnb8812"]JohnB8812[/URL] [/B]Looks like you were right.
Found some replacement io board and cable, just the high fan speed now :D
I will remember to always check with another IO board!

Thank you [B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL] [/B]I will see if I can sort this fan issue now

All sorted now.

Thank you very much for your help!

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
I suppose corrosion still affects the board.
Possibly some crap accumulated under SMC/CPU.
You can try heating them untill 180-200 degrees; use only quality flux.
But inspect first for any liquid sign on the board.

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
Ok,
before doing anything else I tried a software solution.
Macs Fan Control seems to be working great. I tied the fan to the cpu core temps.
Any way to make the change permanent or this solution is better?
BTW all temps displayed in the app are below 35 so not sure why the fan kicks in at all :/

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message: Run HWMonitor, it shows more information...

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
thank you

OK, cpu heatpipe, cpu proximity, pch die, memory proximity and airflow report 128 degrees Celcius. I am guessing one or more sensores are broken, yes?

threads.title: Another 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, number of issues
threads.message:
Start digging around <CHIP>U5800</CHIP>, page 44.
Check all related sensors, traces, resistors...
